review: My favorite burger chain restaurant. Changed it up with the Fish 'n Chips this time and was very satisfied. Lightly breaded, very little residual grease and four flavorful pieces. They even have malt vinegar for the fries. Cup of chili to start was meaty and not too spicy. Service was prompt as always.

What happened to this place?  Used to be decent.  Portions have decreased, garlic parm fries now have some kind of powder sprinkled on them.  Endless fries.....you will wait endlessly until they ask if you would like more.  Will not go back.

I must be unlucky. I have eaten here four times. Once, it was delicious, absolutely yummy. The other three times, my burger was way over cooked, bland, and unimpressive for a "gourmet" burger place. I have been terribly dissapointed, and I was not there in rushed times. They have nice frozen drinks...but burger gods, I guess not. INCONSISTENT.
Good food! Has a new way of paying by a Ziosk and I'm very happy about that it was fun to do!

went in for lunch today with my family and the waitress we got was ok. she seemed like she didn't like her job. I ordered a bacon cheese burger open faced but it didn't come out that way. burger was good.
Great, fast and friendly service!! We got there at 10:52pm but they still took our order to go. NOTE!!!! This restaurant is closed at 11pm NOT midnight!!!

I can honestly say that EVERY time I have been here they have messed up our order. Today was no exception. I had called ahead to "preorder" our food as this was literally over a lunch "hour" and this would save time. I had the preprinted menu that is on their website in my hand. I called the phone number provided via Google. I was prompted with an automated woman telling me to "Press 1 for carry out, press 2 to speak with the restaurant staff." I pressed 2 and was told, "I'm sorry, that option does not exist." Um....okaaaay. So I pressed 1. I spoke with staff and made it very clear that we were dining in, just preordering to save time. I called at 11:30 for a 12:10 arrival time. We ordered an Apple Harvest chicken salad, a 1/2 soup and salad with French onion soup and spinach artichoke dip as an appetizer. We arrived at 12:10. The dining room might have had 6 tables full. The host wound us around the entire restaurant to seat us at a table in the back. A DIRTY table. As I'm looking around at the 20 CLEAN tables around us, I'm like, seriously?? He says, "Is this okay?" As I look at him, again like, seriously? He says, "Well, I'll come back and wipe it off." Yeah, clever boy. Then our waiter arrives. I tell him that we preordered our food. he says, "You did?" No, I'm lying.. He comes back with the spinach dip. No plates, no silverware, no napkins. Didn't take our drink order. There were 10 pieces of celery, about 50 chips and about 1/2 cup of dip. It was tasty, but for $8? Tad pricey. And had 2 huge chunks of artichoke in it. I can say that I have never had to cut my dip before.. Then our food arrives. The soup was stone cold and one salad was completely incorrect. I looked at the salad and said, "This doesn't look like the Apple Harvest chicken salad." To which the waiter brightly states, "What doesn't?" Um...the Mars rover... or, perhaps, THE SALAD IN FRONT OF ME. He trots off and a female manager appears. She tells us that they don't even make that salad anymore and "It was his mistake", referring to the person who took my order. She asked me if she "could make me something else real quick", which I appreciated, but the entire reason for preordering was that we were on a time frame. I didn't have 15 minutes for her to make me a new meal. We were about 3 minutes into eating the food we were presented when the waiter appears again, now he has our bill in I his hand. He says they took off 10%. 10%?? How about COMPING my WRONG FOOD ORDER??? And since he brought us the bill, I guess we weren't invited to have coffee or dessert. We will NOT be back...

What can I say? Red Robin makes good food. It's a national chain, so it is probably gonna be good. Where it will have variables is in staffing. In the last few times I've been there and especially this last time, I went to do the take out and had to stand there w/ my thumb up my butt until someone noticed me. I mean like "kids walkin' by a pile of crap in the living room without seeing it" wait. BTW, some of the "walker's by" were manager geeks. Still, when I was helped, the nice young lady "Ashley" I think it was, took my order and was very nice. She kept them from getting a bad review.  Anyway, good food. Can't really tell you about the service, it was spotty.
Delicious burgers, per usual. Have only eaten at the bar a few times and the service is always great.  My boyfriend is now obsessed with their royal burger!

Seems to be a brand new location.  Sitting here as I type. Service was great. Got the steak sliders which were great.  The baked potato soup was delicious. Wished it weren't so far away.  Will be back.

This Red Robin has the best service and food than any other I've been to! I was a little worried when I pulled into the lot and it was full but they didn't let me down! Bottomless Fries.........yummmmmmmmmmmm!!!

I LOVE RED ROBIN. I can't say it enough! I am NEVER disappointed!  I suggest getting the bonsai burger- it has a slice of pineapple on it, and it is AMAZING. Also, the freckled lemonade (has strawberries in it) is also AMAZING.  They also have bottomless steak fries with their burgers, but I am always too full to order more!  Children always get balloons and crayons and coloring pages as well!

A family establishment with a specialty of burgers, veggie patties, and bison burgers. We were on a family trip and coming back home when we needed some gas. It was fairly close to the highway, but looked like it was in the middle of nowhere with other shopping places and food places. By far, Red Robin had to be the best place to go. I had the blue cheese Bison burger and it was delicious. The burger was well made and not over done or underdone. The toppings did not overpower the taste of the actual burger, which was a major plus for me. Service was quick and our waiter checked on us frequently. Red Robin is a great place to take a large group, family, or just a place to get a good burger. I don't think you can go wrong when you order from the menu. My mom had a California burger (burger with avocado) and dad had the BBQ burger. Both looked and tasted great!

We are definitely Red Robin fans and this in one of the best run Red Robins we have been to. Almost always good service, consistent food, and quick service as well. We are definitely regulars - one of the best hamburger chains!

New establishment in a new shopping complex off of Route 81 in Chambersburg, PA. Red Robins are known for their burgers.  I've sworn off beef, but I heard that you could get a veggie or bocca burger in any of the Red Robin flavors. Plus they have chicken and fish sandwiches too.  And bottomless fries. I'm happy to say that it was crowded, always a good sign, and that the wait staff and hostesses were efficient.  I got a Mexican style burger (can't recall the name), with a bocca burger replacement.  My husband got the same burger with beef.  Both were excellent.  The bocca is so realistic that at first I thought I had the beef--this is a little unnerving when you don't want to eat beef!  The fries were good. We actually got seconds.  Excellent sweet tea too. Chambersburg has been in need of eateries.  We'll go back as this was a pleasant experience.
What a great place to eat for an old fart like me. Reminds me of the good old days. Burgers and malts. I'll be there alot. Great service, food and prices.
Really good burger joint in a new area of Chambersburg.  They have really good milk shakes too.  Price is pretty reasonable.

Never had bad food at this location, but I've had mixed feelings about their bar. The last two visits they were missing ingredients to make the drinks we ordered. Also recommend using the the POS to order drinks from the bar. Much quicker service that way. Otherwise, nothing stellar but no complaints.

Well, I returned back for my second (and LAST) time at the Chambersburg Red Robin. My first time was about a year ago.... my party had a bad experience and reported it to corporate, who in turn had the store manager, Betsy, call me to apologize and offer complimentary gift cards in order for us to give them a second chance (she forgot to send the cards BTW for about a month!)  At any rate, we decided to give The Red Robin managed by Betsey another chance..... and I regret it thoroughly. Please bear in mind, I'm not the hardest person to please, and writing negative reviews is not something I do unless something extraordinary bad. Considering how empty the restaurant was, there should have been no excuse for our poor service and sub-par food. We were rushed to order by our waitress (can't remember her name.... dark hair, had a tattoo on the inside of her upper right arm, had a worn "X" sharpied on her hand indicating she must have been out the night before partying).... we went ahead and ordered their appetizer of chips, guacamole, and salsa... what arrived what shockingly sparse.... I have seen airlines offer larger portions. One small (as in carry out dipping sauce container sized.... about two three tablespoons) container of guacamole, another tiny container of salsa with a tiny bowl that maybe had about twelve tortillas in it. All that for $5. That was just laughable. Onto the second course: we ordered burgers with fries, and were offered a number of their dipping sauces which we were told were free of charge. Many of the flavors seemed interesting and we each asked for three different varieties. Our burgers came and they were rather small for what you would have expected for a $15 hamburger (smaller than I remembered in the past).... they were rather flavorless, the buns seemed not very fresh, and overall it was just "messy". Nothing we received looked as advertised. We also received only one of the different sauces we asked for (and those were wrong) I asked for steak sauce and napkins (we only had one on the table since we were seated) the waitress returned after a lengthy delay with three napkins and an empty bottle of steak sauce. WTF. I waited patiently for her to return (which she did not for over twenty minutes) allowing my wife to enjoy her meal while I waited..... as my burger was nearly fully cold, I decided to just eat it. Finally after about 25 minutes since she dropped off the food she returned... asking for more fries (we each received about TEN each initially), she kept asking if we just wanted to split one order.... finally she got it straight and returned with our fries.... my order had a whopping NINE fries on the plate. It was like pulling teeth to get her to come back... Our bill was almost $49.... for a iced tea, two hamburgers, and a $5 miniature airline portion of chips and guacamole/salsa. We were charged for about 6 of the "FREE" dipping sauces (at 75 cents each) even though we only received 4 of them after having had asked about four times! How can they charge $50 for dinner for two at a hamburger joint with crappy food and service? Thoroughly disgusting. What a fall from grace! Incredibly overpriced for (mostly) frozen ingredients that cost pennies on the dollar they charge! Even with the complimentary $30 gift card we had from our previous bad visit.... this wasn't nearly worth the remaining $18 we had to pay (plus tip.... she wasn't the most attentive waitress, but she meant well).  Strike Two. I don't need to give it a third shot.  Sayonara, Red Robin! Don't be so stingy! Update: after all this time, no upper management from Red Robin has attempted to right this wrong!

It's very easy to go overboard at Red Robin and as I'm thinking Thanksgiving, I'm trying to make healthy choices. Sure, they have salads here and you can get fruit instead of fries. But... burgers. So I compromised and went with the simple chicken burger, which was a grilled chicken breast with LTO and pickles. Yes, I had the steak fries and while they're refillable upon request, I opted not to. The chicken was great. Not dry and rather tasty with the toppings. The fries were excellent and I added some of the Red Robin special salt to them. Yum. I don't feel guilty at all. Service was good. No waiting for the check - they have one of the table kiosk things where you can pay when you're ready. Easy! Lots of sports channels. I was a little bummed that one was showing a hunting television show. I don't need that while I'm eating, but I managed to get the lamp in my line of sight and it was done.

We had a party of 12 and I had called in just to let them know we were coming  The manager was able with his quick thinking able to seat us quickly   He was excellent in his job. The waitress we had was excellent. She was very professional and served us very well

We had been here many times and this past time was the Worst service ever.  Our waitress, Kayla, did not put our order in correctly and never returned to our table in order to correct the problem till it was tike to bring the check. Meanwhile our drinks have been empty and they swooped in so fast that we couldn't even grab attention for beverages.  Hope this isn't going to be the new standard here or we will take our business else where.

The food was good and the service was good. However I felt the menu was misleading in its pictures of the food. I felt like it over promised and under delivered. Why the 2 stars.....it is a poor value. We had 4 burgers and a kids chicken strips meal. We had 2 lemonades and 2 soda's. The bill with tip.....$101.00. To be fair that included a $5 donation that they came to our table to solicit for a cancer fund drive.  Oh and a $1.99 charge for the kids to use on table thing.  Not worth it in my opinion, but if 4 burger meals and a kids meal are worth over $100 to you, go for it.

It's your typical Red Robin so not much to say. The menu is the standard that you'll find in any city or town. Now I will compliment their staff. They are very nice and considerate to the needs or wants of their customers. I just wish they would come down on their prices.

My Aunt, wife, 6 month old son and I went here on 3 Oct and expected the usual great service and food. Well, while waiting for a seat a server (Domineque I believe it's spelled) treated some of her co-wokers like they were crap! We were seated and ordered our food.  The same girl served our food and asked us who had the "mushroom sandwich". we looked at each other and my Aunt asked if it was the mushroom swiss burger to which Miss D replied "It's the only one here with mushrooms".  We ate our food and I addressed Miss D's attitude with the manager on duty and I hope Miss D cleans up her attitude.

Food and service was good... However the attitude of the manager on duty was disheartening. Generally speaking, I'm not the pickiest eater on the planet, however Iam conscious about what, and where, the food I eat comes from. I asked our waitress about the origin of the cod they had on the menu (bear in mind on the menu it is listed as "Arctic Cod"), to which point the manager came out with the box to show us. Listed on the side was "imported from China". This is an immediate red flag for me due to the lack of food safety and contaminants known in the Chinese farm raised fish industry.... I'm sorry but chowing down on fish that is fed human excrement and has high levels of other contaminants is not my idea of a good meal. Not to mention, the false advertising aspects. At any rate, after the manager left. We noticed her laughing about us and making gestures about us.  Google "Chinese fish imports" and you will see countless links on this.

Went in for lunch.  Have been here several times in the past this visit was definitely the best. We were seated quickly by the hostess and our waitress Shae came over right away to take our drink orders.  She was very polite and pleasant, made a few recommendation that we took advantage of.  Food came out quickly and was delicious! Great experience and I recommended to my guest we need more people like Shae on our teams.

I like the Royal Burger and the atomsphere at Red Robin. The milk shakes are excellent! And even though I don't drink you can get a adult drink here. The staff is always friendly and the restaurant kept clean. f you just want to relax and grab some food this is a great choice. Waiting on more location in Florida such as Jacksonville. I find one whenever I am in the mid-Atlantic states.

We went for my son's birthday. I brought 12 people and it's the first bad experience I've ever had at Red Robin. We had 2 broken soda glasses on 2 separate occasions. The soda carbonation was way off and not drinkable. The top shelf margaritas tasted like they hardly any alcohol in them. My sons order wasn't put in and so he got his food about 10 minutes after everyone else's and no compensation for any of this. The nachos were good. I called the manager and she returned my call and offered a $10 gift card. That's not really comparable to what I spent and what we experienced but at least she tried. I'm not sure I'll go back again to use the gift card.

The Red Robin in Chambersburg always delivers a wonderful burger.  Service is sometimes a bit slow, but I don't mind as long as I have a cold beer. Speaking of beer, their beer prices are outrageous, but what can you do? I've tried several burgers and they're all good.  The meat is always tender, no full of gristle, and cooked to perfection.  Well done but never dry.  If you get a burger with bacon, the bacon is pretty darn good.  Not too fatty, not too thick and not paper-thin.  Burgers with the onion straws are a bit greasy, but taste amazing.   You'll likely have to wait if you go on a Saturday evening.  We try to go around 4:30-5:00 to avoid a long wait. The Ziosk allows you to pay at the table without the need of the server.  You can use your credit card or a gift card right there.  Some people may not find this to be very secure, but I think you can request the server swipe your card, or just bring cash. This really is a great place to go for an awesome burger.

I love going to Red Robin.  I love the Whiskey River BBQ burger, get it every time.  The burgers are generally always delicious.  Probably go around 4-5/yr I would give 5 stars if Red Robin was a little bit more consistent with food, usually ordering your burger med gets you anywhere from medium...to overly well done.  Average it's usually medium well to well.  Unfortunately you can't order medium rare to compensate for that.  Wish they could tighten the distribution up a little bit.   Service is usually great, not always perfect but good.

This place was great. Food was satisfying and our server was really nice. I got a bleu burger with garlic herb fries that made our party of 5 order 3 rounds of fries. Our server was John and a big shoutout to him!
Burgers were very good and cooked to order. Our waitress was friendly and attentive. Food took a while if it was faster 5 stars.
The quality of service leaves a bit to be desired. The freckled lemonade is delicious. The Ziosk on the table is very convenient.

The food is good. Haven't had a bad burger here yet. Service can be a hit or miss but overall not too bad. We've occasionally gotten a rude or indifferent server but not bad enough to keep is from coming back. My biggest reservation about this place is the price, mostly with the appetizers. Thank goodness they started to offer the smaller portions otherwise I would go bankrupt. For the short stack of onion rings it's $5, for the full order it's nearly $10. That is RIDICULOUS for onion rings. They do taste good, but not worth $10. It's the occasional date for us here because of the cost.
Red Robin never fails!!! I order the fish and chips. The fish was piping hot with full of flavor! Thanx guys!!

Damn good burgers and our waitress, Lyz was absolutely fantastic. I had the chop house burger, it's not one of my normal burgers, but it will be now. My GF had the California Baja chicken, with crispy chicken, she "lurved it".
